Pre-Game Insights: Lee Carsley's England are under enormous pressure to respond after a 2-1 defeat to Greece.
Finland have not scored a goal in their last three matches and have conceded multiple goals in six of their last seven games.
George Baldock, a former Sheffield United and Greece right-back, tragically passed away at 31, leading to a request for the match against England to be postponed.
Finland have never lost to England in 12 encounters, but their recent form has been poor.
Harry Kane may be considered for minutes as a substitute if he is passed fit, and Carsley will consider bringing in either Dominic Solanke or Ollie Watkins to spearhead the attack.
Finland's Joel Pohjanpalo started against Ireland, but Teemu Pukki may come into contention for a start given the quick turnaround.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will be held at Helsingin olympiastadion in Helsinki.
Finland are competing in the second tier of the Nations League for the third campaign running and are currently bottom of the group.
England have won 10 out of 12 matches against Finland, with the last meeting resulting in a 2-1 win for England.
